intro: Brachylepis nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined brachylepis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, spreading habit with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypselae. Brachylepis nervosa is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats.
